title: shepherd_gee
author: shepherd_gee
content: Investment strategy one implement be it short-term or long-term is channeled for profit maximization. Cryptocurrency on it's own is a solid long-term investment, one which is volatile and unpredictable, which is also a speculative investment. I will say it have outperformed most asset classes in recent years; including stocks, bond, gold, and real estate. Cryptocurrency is the tomorrow of today.

comments.author: Charles-Tim
comments.body: But be careful of cryptocurrencies. Some can make you rich and some can be a nightmare for you. Cryptocurrencies are harbouring scammers. You can read about scam in DeFi and DAO and see why you need to avoid some aspect of cryptocurrencies by making proper research. There are many new projects that are mainly created by scammers and some are just pumped and dumped which are obvious scam. Advice:There are just few good cryptocurrencies and it is advisable to go for bitcoin. Some altcoins will not reach all-time-high and while many will dump more to almost or lower than their pre-halving price after bull market that is followed by bear market. But bitcoin has proven itself to be a store of value in long term.

When using the word "cryptocurrency " please be specific so you don't mislead the uniformed.  In other words, Saying that cryptocurrency have outperformed most asset classes is actually equivocation because many people have be wrecked by cryptocurrency.  This is why it becomes very important to be specific when using that term. If you say Bitcoin have performed better than stock and many asset classes, it is understood because that is the fact.... many people have had their lives transformed through Bitcoin. On the other hand, Luna and other cryptocurrencies that failed, have destroyed many lives. I will encourage anyone willing to start building their portfolio to consider Bitcoin that is the pioneer and most reliable digital currency.

comments.author: Dr.Bitcoin_Strange
comments.body: @OP, Generally, there are thousands of cryptocurrencies in the space, and Bitcoin is the head of them all. When referring to Bitcoin, it's better to spell it out; otherwise,  it will be concluded that you are not only referring to a particular cryptocurrency. If you are not also specifically talking about Bitcoin, then you should move your topic to the altcoin discussion board.One character of Bitcoin is volatility, and that's why it's better to invest in it and hold it in your wallet until the bull market, but if you are investing in altcoins, you should also prepare your mind for any losses you may incur.

comments.author: Ruttoshi
comments.body: OP, it is bitcoin that you are talking about and not just any cryptocurrency. Bitcoin is the one that has the potential to overpower every other assets that has been existing long ago, due to its volatile nature. If you want to invest, you should invest in bitcoin for a long term and don't think of a short term investment because, you might end up running at loss, since nobody can predict the price movement of bitcoin accurately but only with past records and that is why it is called speculation.Newbies don't know the difference between bitcoin and other cryptocurrency and that is why they can easily be deceived to invest on the wrong coins. Don't be greedy and follow the hype of those other cryptocurrency, since majority of them are pump and dump shitcoins. Only use the amount that you can avoid to lose to invest as a beginner whose faith isn't strong yet in bitcoin.

comments.author: freedomgo
comments.body: Bitcoin is indeed a sound investment choice. When discussing cryptocurrency, it's best to focus solely on Bitcoin and not get distracted by altcoins. Comparing it to other investments like stocks, bonds, gold, and real estate, Bitcoin stands out.While Bitcoin is considered a speculative asset, delving deeper into its studies reveals interesting facts. There's a genuine and continuously growing demand for Bitcoin. Moreover, with increasing government acceptance and regulation, its future is expected to become more stable. So, if you're planning to invest or diversify your investments, putting your trust in Bitcoin is a viable option. Just HODL onto it, and you'll be in good shape.

The cryptocurrency market has outperformed other assets and stocks in recent years in terms of growth. I suppose this is due to the spike in popularity and accessibility. However, this doesn't necessarily mean it's better. Remember that most cryptocurrencies are volatile, which means traders and investors could lose a significant portion of their investment within a short period of time. Invest wisely, and one way to do that is to become familiarized how it works.

comments.author: Husires
comments.body: part of cryptocurrencies do not have a long track record through which we can say or judge that they have outperformed assets such as stocks, bonds, gold, and real estate, which have been around for decades, while most of the current cryptocurrencies did not exist in 2013. This huge difference makes the comparison illogical because we are witnessing...
